options.note:
If set to false, the path
$GNUPGHOME/pubring.kbx will become an immutable
link to the Nix store, denying modifications.

options.title: programs.gpg.mutableTrust
options.description: If set to true, you may manage trust as a user using the gpg command. Upon activation, trusted keys have their trust set without overwriting unmanaged keys.
options.note:
If set to false, the path
$GNUPGHOME/trustdb.gpg will be
overwritten on each activation, removing trust for
any unmanaged keys. Be careful to make a backup of your old
trustdb.gpg before switching to immutable trust!

options.description: Whether to enable pubs.

options.title: programs.pubs.package
options.description: The package to use for the pubs script.

options.title: programs.pubs.extraConfig
options.description: Configuration using syntax written to $HOME/.pubsrc.
options.example:
''
[main]
pubsdir = ${config.home.homeDirectory}/.pubs
docsdir = ${config.home.homeDirectory}/.pubs/doc
doc_add = link
open_cmd = xdg-open

[plugins]
active = git,alias

[[alias]]

[[[la]]]
command = list -a
description = lists papers in lexicographic order

[[git]]
quiet = True
manual = False
force_color = False
''

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyBindings
options.description: Key bindings mapping keys to commands in different modes. This setting is a dictionary containing mode names and dictionaries mapping keys to commands: {mode: {key: command}} If you want to map a key to another key, check the keyMappings setting instead. For modifiers, you can use either - or + as delimiters, and these names:
options.note: ControlControl, CtrlMetaMeta, Windows, Mod4AltAlt, Mod1ShiftShift
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of strings concatenated with " ;; "

options.description: Control, Ctrl
Meta, Windows, Mod4
Alt, Mod1
Shift
Default mode, where most commands are invoked.

Entered when an input field is focused on a website, or by pressing i in normal mode. Passes through almost all keypresses to the website, but has some bindings like <Ctrl-e> to open an external editor. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when f is pressed to select links with the keyboard. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.

Similar to insert mode, but passes through all keypresses except <Escape> to leave the mode. It might be useful to bind <Escape> to some other key in this mode if you want to be able to send an Escape key to the website as well. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when pressing the : key in order to enter a command. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when there’s a prompt to display, like for download locations or when invoked from JavaScript.
Entered when there’s a yes/no prompt displayed.
Entered when pressing the v mode, used to select text using the keyboard.
Entered when qutebrowser is waiting for a register name/key for commands like :set-mark.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyMappings
options.description: This setting can be used to map keys to other keys. When the key used as dictionary-key is pressed, the binding for the key used as dictionary-value is invoked instead. This is useful for global remappings of keys, for example to map Ctrl-[ to Escape. Note that when a key is bound (via bindings.default or bindings.commands), the mapping is ignored.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.loadAutoconfig
options.description: Load settings configured via the GUI.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.quickmarks
options.description: Quickmarks to add to qutebrowser’s quickmarks file. Note that when Home Manager manages your quickmarks, you cannot edit them at runtime.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.searchEngines
options.description: Search engines that can be used via the address bar. Maps a search engine name (such as DEFAULT, or ddg) to a URL with a {} placeholder. The placeholder will be replaced by the search term, use {{ and }} for literal {/} signs. The search engine named DEFAULT is used when url.auto_search is turned on and something else than a URL was entered to be opened. Other search engines can be used by prepending the search engine name to the search term, for example :open google qutebrowser.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.settings
options.description: Options to add to qutebrowser config.py file. See https://qutebrowser.org/doc/help/settings.html for options.

options.title: programs.xmobar.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Xmobar, a minimalistic status bar.

options.title: programs.xmobar.package
options.description: Package providing the xmobar binary.

options.title: programs.xmobar.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/xmobar/.xmobarrc. See https://xmobar.org/#configuration for options.
options.example:
Config
  { font        = "Fira Code"
  , borderColor = "#d0d0d0"
  , border      = FullB
  , borderWidth = 3
  , bgColor     = "#222"
  , fgColor     = "grey"
  , position    = TopSize C 99 30
  , commands    =
      [ Run Cpu ["-t", "cpu: <fc=#4eb4fa><bar> <total>%</fc>"] 10
      , Run Network "enp3s0" ["-S", "True", "-t", "eth: <fc=#4eb4fa><rx></fc>/<fc=#4eb4fa><tx></fc>"] 10
      , Run Memory ["-t","mem: <fc=#4eb4fa><usedbar> <usedratio>%</fc>"] 10
      , Run Date "date: <fc=#4eb4fa>%a %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S </fc>" "date" 10
      , Run StdinReader
      ]
  , sepChar     = "%"
  , alignSep    = "}{"
  , template    = "  %StdinReader% | %cpu% | %memory% | %enp3s0%  }{%date%  "
  }

options.description: Gammastep derivation to use.

options.description: Set the time interval of dawn manually. The times must be specified as HH:MM in 24-hour format.

options.title: services.gammastep.duskTime
options.description: Set the time interval of dusk manually. The times must be specified as HH:MM in 24-hour format.

options.title: services.gammastep.latitude
options.description: Your current latitude, between -90.0 and 90.0. Must be provided along with longitude.
options.type: null or string or floating point number

options.title: services.gammastep.longitude
options.description: Your current longitude, between -180.0 and 180.0. Must be provided along with latitude.
options.type: null or string or floating point number

options.title: services.gammastep.provider
options.description: The location provider to use for determining your location. If set to manual you must also provide latitude/longitude. If set to geoclue2, you must also enable the global geoclue2 service.

options.title: services.gammastep.settings
options.description: The configuration to pass to Gammastep. Available options for Gammastep described in gammastep(1).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

options.title: services.gammastep.temperature.day
options.description: Colour temperature to use during the day, between 1000 and 25000 K.

options.title: services.gammastep.temperature.night
options.description: Colour temperature to use at night, between 1000 and 25000 K.

options.title: services.gammastep.tray
options.description: Start the gammastep-indicator tray applet.

options.title: services.getmail.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the getmail systemd service to automatically retrieve mail.

options.title: services.getmail.frequency
options.description: The refresh frequency. Check man systemd.time for more information on the syntax. If you use a gpg-agent in combination with the passwordCommand, keep the poll frequency below the cache-ttl value (as set by the default) to avoid pinentry asking permanently for a password.

options.title: services.git-sync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable git-sync services.

options.title: services.git-sync.package
options.description: Package containing the git-sync program.

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories
options.description: The repositories that should be synchronized.

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories.<name>.interval
options.description: The interval, specified in seconds, at which the synchronization will be triggered even without filesystem changes.

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories.<name>.path
options.description: The path at which to sync the repository

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories.<name>.uri
options.description: The URI of the remote to be synchronized. This is only used in the event that the directory does not already exist. See https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone#_git_urls for the supported URIs.
options.note: This option is not supported on Darwin.

options.title: services.gnome-keyring.enable
options.description: Whether to enable GNOME Keyring.

options.title: services.gnome-keyring.components
options.description: The GNOME keyring components to start. If empty then the default set of components will be started.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enable
options.description: Whether to enable GnuPG private key agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableBashIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableExtraSocket
options.description: Whether to enable extra socket of the GnuPG key agent (useful for GPG Agent forwarding).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableFishIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableScDaemon
options.description: Make use of the scdaemon tool. This option has the effect of enabling the ability to do smartcard operations. When disabled, this option passes disable-scdaemon setting to gpg-agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableSshSupport
options.description: Whether to use the GnuPG key agent for SSH keys.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableZshIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.defaultCacheTtl
options.description: Set the time a cache entry is valid to the given number of seconds.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.defaultCacheTtlSsh
options.description: Set the time a cache entry used for SSH keys is valid to the given number of seconds.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to append to the gpg-agent configuration file.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.grabKeyboardAndMouse
options.description: Tell the pinentry to grab the keyboard and mouse. This option should in general be used to avoid X-sniffing attacks. When disabled, this option passes no-grab setting to gpg-agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.maxCacheTtl
options.description: Set the maximum time a cache entry is valid to n seconds. After this time a cache entry will be expired even if it has been accessed recently or has been set using gpg-preset-passphrase. The default is 2 hours (7200 seconds).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.maxCacheTtlSsh
options.description: Set the maximum time a cache entry used for SSH keys is valid to n seconds. After this time a cache entry will be expired even if it has been accessed recently or has been set using gpg-preset-passphrase. The default is 2 hours (7200 seconds).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.pinentryFlavor
options.description: Which pinentry interface to use. If not null, it sets pinentry-program in gpg-agent.conf. Beware that pinentry-gnome3 may not work on non-Gnome systems. You can fix it by adding the following to your system configuration:
options.note: services.dbus.packages = [ pkgs.gcr ];

options.title: services.gpg-agent.sshKeys
options.description: Which GPG keys (by keygrip) to expose as SSH keys.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.verbose
options.description: Whether to produce verbose output.

options.title: services.grobi.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the grobi display setup daemon.

options.title: services.grobi.executeAfter
options.description: Commands to be run after an output configuration was changed. The Nix value declared here will be translated to JSON and written to the execute_after key in $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/grobi.conf.

options.title: services.grobi.rules
options.description: These are the rules grobi tries to match to the current output configuration. The rules are evaluated top to bottom, the first matching rule is applied and processing stops. See https://github.com/fd0/grobi/blob/master/doc/grobi.conf for more information. The Nix value declared here will be translated to JSON and written to the rules key in $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/grobi.conf.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.enable

options.description: A keysym or raw keycode that toggles the activation state of gromit-mpx.  Set to null to disable the hotkey in which case you’ll have to activate gromit-mpx manually using the command line.
options.type: null or string or positive integer, meaning >0

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.opacity
options.description: Opacity of the drawing overlay.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools
options.description: Tool definitions for gromit-mpx to use.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.arrowSize
options.description: If not null, automatically draw an arrow at the end of a stroke with the given size.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.color
options.description: The stroke (or recolor) color of the tool.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.device
options.description: Use this tool with the given xinput device.  The device with the name default works with any input.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.modifiers
options.description: Only activate this tool if the given modifiers are also active.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.size
options.description: The tool size.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.type
options.description: Which type of tool this is.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.undoKey
options.description: A keysym or raw keycode that causes gromit-mpx to undo the last stroke.  Use this key along with the shift key to redo an undone stoke.  Set to null to disable the undo hotkey.
options.type: null or string or positive integer, meaning >0

options.description: Extra configuration lines to append to the kanshi configuration file.

options.description: List of profiles.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.exec
options.description: Commands executed after the profile is successfully applied. Note that if you provide multiple commands, they will be executed asynchronously with no guaranteed ordering.
options.type: (list of string) or string convertible to it

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs
options.description: Outputs configuration.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.adaptiveSync
options.description: Enables or disables adaptive synchronization (aka. Variable Refresh Rate).

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.criteria
options.description: The criteria can either be an output name, an output description or “*”. The latter can be used to match any output.
options.note:
On
sway(1),
output names and descriptions can be obtained via
swaymsg -t get_outputs.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.mode
options.description: <width>x<height>[@<rate>[Hz]]
options.note:
Configures the specified output to use the specified mode.
Modes are a combination of width and height (in pixels) and
a refresh rate (in Hz) that your display can be configured to use.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.position
options.note:
Places the output at the specified position in the global coordinates
space.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.scale
options.description: Scales the output by the specified scale factor.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.status
options.description: Enables or disables the specified output.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.transform
options.description: Sets the output transform.

options.description: Systemd target to bind to.

options.description: Which lorri package to install.

options.description: Which nix package to use.

options.title: services.mako.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Mako, lightweight notification daemon for Wayland .

options.title: services.mako.package
options.description: The mako package to use.

options.title: services.mako.actions
options.description: Applications may request an action to be associated with activating a notification. Disabling this will cause mako to ignore these requests.

options.title: services.mako.anchor
options.description: Show notifications at the specified position on the output. Supported values are top-right, top-center, top-left, bottom-right, bottom-center, bottom-left, and center.

options.title: services.mako.backgroundColor
options.description: Set popup background color to a specific color, represented in hex color code.

options.title: services.mako.borderColor
options.description: Set popup border color to a specific color, represented in hex color code.

options.title: services.mako.borderRadius
options.description: Set popup corner radius to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.borderSize
options.description: Set popup border size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.defaultTimeout
options.description: Set the default timeout to timeout in milliseconds. To disable the timeout, set it to zero.

options.title: services.mako.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration.

options.title: services.mako.font
options.description: Font to use, in Pango format.

options.title: services.mako.format
options.description: Set notification format string to format. See FORMAT SPECIFIERS for more information. To change this for grouped notifications, set it within a grouped criteria.

options.title: services.mako.groupBy
options.description: A comma-separated list of criteria fields that will be compared to other visible notifications to determine if this one should form a group with them. All listed criteria must be exactly equal for two notifications to group.

options.title: services.mako.height
options.description: Set maximum height of notification popups. Notifications whose text takes up less space are shrunk to fit.

options.title: services.mako.iconPath
options.description: Paths to search for icons when a notification specifies a name instead of a full path. Colon-delimited. This approximates the search algorithm used by the XDG Icon Theme Specification, but does not support any of the theme metadata. Therefore, if you want to search parent themes, you’ll need to add them to the path manually.
options.note:
The /usr/share/icons/hicolor and
/usr/share/pixmaps directories are
always searched.

options.title: services.mako.icons
options.description: Whether or not to show icons in notifications.

options.title: services.mako.ignoreTimeout
options.description: If set, mako will ignore the expire timeout sent by notifications and use the one provided by default-timeout instead.

options.title: services.mako.layer
options.description: Arrange mako at the specified layer, relative to normal windows. Supported values are background, bottom, top, and overlay. Using overlay will cause notifications to be displayed above fullscreen windows, though this may also occur at top depending on your compositor.

options.title: services.mako.margin
options.description: Set margin of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value to apply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will set vertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated will give each edge a separate value. For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20 and bottom to five.

options.title: services.mako.markup
options.description: If 1, enable Pango markup. If 0, disable Pango markup. If enabled, Pango markup will be interpreted in your format specifier and in the body of notifications.

options.title: services.mako.maxIconSize
options.description: Set maximum icon size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.maxVisible
options.description: Set maximum number of visible notifications. Set -1 to show all.

options.title: services.mako.output
options.description: Show notifications on the specified output. If empty, notifications will appear on the focused output. Requires the compositor to support the Wayland protocol xdg-output-unstable-v1 version 2.

options.title: services.mako.padding
options.description: Set padding of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value to apply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will set vertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated will give each edge a separate value. For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20 and bottom to five.

options.title: services.mako.progressColor
options.description: Set popup progress indicator color to a specific color, represented in hex color code. To draw the progress indicator on top of the background color, use the over attribute. To replace the background color, use the source attribute (this can be useful when the notification is semi-transparent).

options.title: services.mako.sort
options.description: Sorts incoming notifications by time and/or priority in ascending(+) or descending(-) order.

options.title: services.mako.textColor
options.description: Set popup text color to a specific color, represented in hex color code.

options.title: services.mako.width
options.description: Set width of notification popups in specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mbsync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mbsync.

options.title: services.mbsync.package
options.description: The package to use for the mbsync binary.

options.title: services.mbsync.configFile
options.description: Optional configuration file to link to use instead of the default file (~/.mbsyncrc).

options.title: services.mbsync.frequency
options.description: How often to run mbsync.  This value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as the onCalendar option.  See systemd.time(7) for more information about the format.

options.title: services.mbsync.postExec
options.description: An optional command to run after mbsync executes successfully. This is useful for running mailbox indexing tools.

options.title: services.mbsync.preExec
options.description: An optional command to run before mbsync executes.  This is useful for creating the directories mbsync is going to use.

options.title: services.mbsync.verbose
options.description: Whether mbsync should produce verbose output.

options.title: services.megasync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Megasync client.

options.title: services.megasync.package
options.description: The megasync package to use.

options.description: Mopidy extensions that should be loaded by the service.

options.title: services.mopidy.extraConfigFiles
options.description: Extra configuration files read by Mopidy when the service starts. Later files in the list override earlier configuration files and structured settings.

options.title: services.mopidy.settings
options.description: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mopidy/mopidy.conf.
options.note:
See https://docs.mopidy.com/en/latest/config/ for
more details.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (Mopidy config value)

options.title: services.mpd.enable

options.title: services.mpd.package
options.description: The MPD package to run.

options.description: Extra directives added to to the end of MPD’s configuration file, mpd.conf. Basic configuration like file location and uid/gid is added automatically to the beginning of the file. For available options see mpd.conf(5).

options.title: services.mpd.musicDirectory
options.description: The directory where mpd reads music from.
options.note:
If xdg.userDirs.enable is
true then the defined XDG music directory is used.
Otherwise, you must explicitly specify a value.

options.title: services.mpd.network.listenAddress
options.description: The address for the daemon to listen on. Use any to listen on all addresses.

options.title: services.mpd.network.port
options.description: The TCP port on which the the daemon will listen.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.mpd.network.startWhenNeeded
options.description: Enable systemd socket activation.

options.title: services.mpd.playlistDirectory
options.description: The directory where mpd stores playlists.

options.title: services.mpd-discord-rpc.package
options.description: mpd-discord-rpc package to use.

options.description: The network used to dial to the MPD server. Check https://golang.org/pkg/net/#Dial for available values (most common are “tcp” and “unix”)

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.password
options.description: The password to connect to MPD.

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.port
options.description: The port number where MPD is listening for connections.

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.useLocal
options.description: Whether to configure for the local MPD daemon. If true the network, host, and port settings are ignored.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.password
options.description: The password to connect to MPD.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.port
options.description: The port number where MPD is listening for connections.

options.title: services.mpdris2.multimediaKeys

options.description: Whether to enable song change notifications.

options.title: services.mpris-proxy.enable
options.description: Whether to enable a proxy forwarding Bluetooth MIDI controls via MPRIS2 to control media players.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes
options.description: Muchsync remotes to synchronise with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.frequency
options.description: How often to run muchsync. This value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as the OnCalendar option. See systemd.time(7) for more information about the format.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.checkForModifiedFiles
options.description: Check for locally modified files. Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir are never edited.
options.note:
checkForModifiedFiles disables certain
optimizations so as to make muchsync at least check the timestamp on
every file, which will detect modified files at the cost of a longer
startup time.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.importNew
options.description: Whether to begin the synchronisation by running notmuch new locally.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.checkForModifiedFiles
options.description: Check for modified files on the remote side. Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir are never edited.
options.note:
checkForModifiedFiles disables certain
optimizations so as to make muchsync at least check the timestamp on
every file, which will detect modified files at the cost of a longer
startup time.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.host
options.description: Remote SSH host to synchronize with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.importNew
options.description: Whether to begin the synchronisation by running notmuch new on the remote side.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.muchsyncPath
options.description: Specifies the path to muchsync on the server. Ordinarily, muchsync should be in the default PATH on the server so this option is not required. However, this option is useful if you have to install muchsync in a non-standard place or wish to test development versions of the code.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.sshCommand
options.description: Specifies a command line to pass to /bin/sh to execute a command on another machine.
options.note:
Note that because this string is passed to the shell,
special characters including spaces may need to be escaped.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.upload
options.description: Whether to propagate local changes to the remote.

scalars or a group itself

options.description: Polybar configuration. Can be either path to a file, or set of attributes that will be used to create the final configuration. See also services.polybar.settings for a more nix-friendly format.
options.type: (attribute set of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)) or path convertible to it

options.title: services.polybar.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration to add.
options.example:
''
  [module/date]
  type = internal/date
  interval = 5
  date = "%d.%m.%y"
  time = %H:%M
  format-prefix-foreground = \''${colors.foreground-alt}
  label = %time%  %date%
''

options.title: services.polybar.script
options.description: This script will be used to start the polybars. Set all necessary environment variables here and start all bars. It can be assumed that polybar executable is in the PATH.
options.note: Note, this script must start all bars in the background and then terminate.

options.title: services.polybar.settings
options.description: Polybar configuration. This takes a nix attrset and converts it to the strange data format that polybar uses. Each entry will be converted to a section in the output file. Several things are treated specially: nested keys are converted to dash-separated keys; the special text key is ignored as a nested key, to allow mixing different levels of nesting; and lists are converted to polybar’s foo-0, foo-1, ... format.
options.note: For example:

options.title: services.xcape.enable
options.description: Whether to enable xcape.

options.title: services.xcape.mapExpression
options.description: The value has the grammar Key[|OtherKey].
options.note:
The list of key names is found in the header file
X11/keysymdef.h (remove the
XK_ prefix). Note that due to limitations
of X11 shifted keys must be specified as a shift key
followed by the key to be pressed rather than the actual
name of the character. For example to generate “{” the
expression Shift_L|bracketleft could be
used (assuming that you have a key with “{” above “[”).

options.title: services.xcape.timeout
options.description: If you hold a key longer than this timeout, xcape will not generate a key event. Default is 500 ms.

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.canceller
options.description: Command executed when the user becomes active again. This is only executed if the next timer has not been reached. Path to executables are accepted. The command is automatically escaped.

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.command
options.description: Command executed after the idle timeout is reached. Path to executables are accepted. The command is automatically escaped.

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.delay

options.title: specialisation
options.description: A set of named specialized configurations. These can be used to extend your base configuration with additional settings. For example, you can have specialisations named “light” and “dark” that apply light and dark color theme configurations.
options.note:
NoteThis is an experimental option for now and you therefore have to
activate the specialisation by looking up and running the activation
script yourself. Running the activation script will create a new
Home Manager generation.

options.title: systemd.user.startServices
options.description: Whether new or changed services that are wanted by active targets should be started. Additionally, stop obsolete services from the previous generation.
options.note: The alternatives are

options.description: Use a very simple shell script to print suggested systemctl commands to run. You will have to manually run those commands after the switch.
Use a Ruby script to, in a more robust fashion, determine the necessary changes and automatically run the systemctl commands.

Use sd-switch, a third party application, to perform the service updates. This tool offers more features while having a small closure size. Note, it requires a fully functional user D-Bus session. Once tested and deemed sufficiently robust, this will become the default.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/hypr/hyprland.conf.
options.example:
''
  # window resize
  bind = $mod, S, submap, resize
  
  submap = resize
  binde = , right, resizeactive, 10 0
  binde = , left, resizeactive, -10 0
  binde = , up, resizeactive, 0 -10
  binde = , down, resizeactive, 0 10
  bind = , escape, submap, reset
  submap = reset
''

options.description: Modifier key or keys that can be used to drag floating windows.

options.description: Whether focus should follow the mouse.

options.description: Whether to force focus wrapping in tabbed or stacked containers.
options.note: This option is deprecated, use focus.wrapping instead.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.mouseWarping
options.description: Whether mouse cursor should be warped to the center of the window when switching focus to a window on a different output.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.newWindow
options.description: This option modifies focus behavior on new window activation.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#focus_on_window_activation

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.wrapping
options.description: Whether the window focus commands automatically wrap around the edge of containers.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_focus_wrapping

options.description: This option controls whether to disable container borders on workspace with a single container.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.vertical
options.description: Vertical gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.input

options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.keybindings
options.description: An attribute set that assigns a key press to an action using a key symbol. See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.note:
Consider to use lib.mkOptionDefault function to extend or override
default keybindings instead of specifying all of them from scratch.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.keycodebindings
options.description: An attribute set that assigns keypress to an action using key code. See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.

options.description: Home row direction key for moving left.

options.description: Default launcher to use.

options.description: An attribute set that defines binding modes and keybindings inside them
options.note:
Only basic keybinding is supported (bindsym keycomb action),
for more advanced setup use ‘sway.extraConfig’.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.modifier
options.description: Modifier key that is used for all default keybindings.

options.description: Whether to run command on each sway restart.

options.description: Command that will be executed on startup.

options.description: Default terminal to run.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.up
options.description: Home row direction key for moving up.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window

options.description: Window border width.

options.description: List of commands that should be executed on specific windows. See for_window swaywm option documentation.

options.description: Swaywm command to execute.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.commands.*.criteria
options.description: Criteria of the windows on which command should be executed.
options.note:
A value of true is equivalent to using an empty
criteria (which is different from an empty string criteria).

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.hideEdgeBorders
options.description: Hide window borders adjacent to the screen edges.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.titlebar
options.description: Whether to show window titlebars.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceAutoBackAndForth
options.description: Assume you are on workspace “1: www” and switch to “2: IM” using mod+2 because somebody sent you a message. You don’t need to remember where you came from now, you can just press $mod+2 again to switch back to “1: www”.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceLayout
options.description: The mode in which new containers on workspace level will start.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceOutputAssign
options.description: Assign workspaces to outputs.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.output
options.description: Name(s) of the output(s) from    swaymsg -t get_outputs .

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.workspace
options.description: Name of the workspace to assign.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/sway/config.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraConfigEarly
options.description: Like extraConfig, except lines are added to ~/.config/sway/config before all other configuration.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraOptions
options.description: Command line arguments passed to launch Sway. Please DO NOT report issues if you use an unsupported GPU (proprietary drivers).

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraSessionCommands
options.description: Shell commands executed just before Sway is started.
options.example:
''
  export SDL_VIDEODRIVER=wayland
  # needs qt5.qtwayland in systemPackages
  export QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland
  export QT_WAYLAND_DISABLE_WINDOWDECORATION="1"
  # Fix for some Java AWT applications (e.g. Android Studio),
  # use this if they aren't displayed properly:
  export _JAVA_AWT_WM_NONREPARENTING=1
''

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.swaynag.enable
options.description: Whether to enable configuration of swaynag, a lightweight error bar for sway.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.swaynag.settings
options.description: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/swaynag/config.
options.note:
See
swaynag(5)
for a list of available options and an example configuration.
Note, configurations declared under <config>
will override the default type values of swaynag.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (Swaynag config atom (null, bool, int, float, str))

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable sway-session.target on sway startup. This links to graphical-session.target. Some important environment variables will be imported to systemd and dbus user environment before reaching the target, including
options.note: DISPLAYWAYLAND_DISPLAYSWAYSOCKXDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.xdgAutostart
options.description: Whether to enable autostart of applications using systemd-xdg-autostart-generator(8) .

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures
options.description: Attribute set of features to enable in the wrapper.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures.base
options.description: Whether to make use of the base wrapper to execute extra session commands and prepend a dbus-run-session to the sway command.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures.gtk
options.description: Whether to make use of the wrapGAppsHook wrapper to execute sway with required environment variables for GTK applications.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.xwayland
options.description: Enable xwayland, which is needed for the default configuration of sway.

options.title: xdg.enable
options.description: Whether to enable management of XDG base directories.

options.title: xdg.cacheHome
options.description: Absolute path to directory holding application caches.

options.title: xdg.configFile
options.description: Attribute set of files to link into the user’s XDG configuration home.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific files to be disabled.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.executable
options.description: Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the mode of the source file or to false for files created through the text option.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.onChange
options.description: Shell commands to run when file has changed between generations. The script will be run after the new files have been linked into place.
options.note:
Note, this code is always run when recursive is
enabled.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.recursive
options.description: If the file source is a directory, then this option determines whether the directory should be recursively linked to the target location. This option has no effect if the source is a file.
options.note:
If false (the default) then the target
will be a symbolic link to the source directory. If
true then the target will be a
directory structure matching the source’s but whose leafs
are symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.source
options.description: Path of the source file or directory. If xdg.configFile.<name>.text is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file containing that text.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.target
options.description: Path to target file relative to xdg.configHome.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.text
options.description: Text of the file. If this option is null then xdg.configFile.<name>.source must be set.

options.title: xdg.configHome
options.description: Absolute path to directory holding application configurations.

options.title: xdg.dataFile
options.description: Attribute set of files to link into the user’s XDG data home.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific files to be disabled.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.executable
options.description: Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the mode of the source file or to false for files created through the text option.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.onChange
options.description: Shell commands to run when file has changed between generations. The script will be run after the new files have been linked into place.
options.note:
Note, this code is always run when recursive is
enabled.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.recursive
options.description: If the file source is a directory, then this option determines whether the directory should be recursively linked to the target location. This option has no effect if the source is a file.
options.note:
If false (the default) then the target
will be a symbolic link to the source directory. If
true then the target will be a
directory structure matching the source’s but whose leafs
are symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.source
options.description: Path of the source file or directory. If xdg.dataFile.<name>.text is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file containing that text.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.target
options.description: Path to target file relative to <varname>xdg.dataHome</varname>.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.text
options.description: Text of the file. If this option is null then xdg.dataFile.<name>.source must be set.

options.title: xdg.dataHome
options.description: Absolute path to directory holding application data.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries
options.description: Desktop Entries allow applications to be shown in your desktop environment’s app launcher.
options.note: You can define entries for programs without entries or override existing entries.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions
options.description: The set of actions made available to application launchers.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.exec
options.description: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.icon
options.description: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.name
options.description: Name of the action.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.categories
options.description: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.comment
options.description: Tooltip for the entry.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.exec
options.description: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.genericName
options.description: Generic name of the application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.icon
options.description: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.mimeType
options.description: The MIME type(s) supported by this application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.name
options.description: Specific name of the application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.noDisplay
options.description: Means “this application exists, but don’t display it in the menus”. This can be useful to e.g. associate this application with MIME types.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.prefersNonDefaultGPU
options.description: If true, the application prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.settings
options.description: Extra key-value pairs to add to the [Desktop Entry] section. This may override other values.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.startupNotify
options.description: If true, it is KNOWN that the application will send a “remove” message when started with the DESKTOP_STARTUP_ID environment variable set. If false, it is KNOWN that the application does not work with startup notification at all.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.terminal
options.description: Whether the program runs in a terminal window.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.type
options.description: The type of the desktop entry.

options.title: xdg.mime.enable
options.description: Whether to install programs and files to support the XDG Shared MIME-info specification and XDG MIME Applications specification at https://specifications.freedesktop.org/shared-mime-info-spec/shared-mime-info-spec-latest.html and https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/mime-apps-spec-latest.html, respectively.
options.default: true if host platform is Linux, false otherwise

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.enable
options.description: Whether to manage $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mimeapps.list.
options.note: The generated file is read-only.

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.associations.added
options.description: Defines additional associations of applications with mimetypes, as if the .desktop file was listing this mimetype in the first place.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.associations.removed
options.description: Removes associations of applications with mimetypes, as if the .desktop file was not listing this mimetype in the first place.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.defaultApplications
options.description: The default application to be used for a given mimetype. This is, for instance, the one that will be started when double-clicking on a file in a file manager. If the application is no longer installed, the next application in the list is attempted, and so on.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

options.title: xresources.extraConfig
options.description: Additional X server resources contents. If this and all other xresources options are null, then this feature is disabled and no ~/.Xresources link is produced.

options.title: xresources.path
options.description: Path where Home Manager should link the .Xresources file.

options.title: xresources.properties
options.description: X server resources that should be set. Booleans are formatted as “true” or “false” respectively. List elements are recursively formatted as a string and joined by commas. All other values are directly formatted using builtins.toString. Note, that 2-dimensional lists are not supported and specifying one will throw an exception. If this and all other xresources options are null, then this feature is disabled and no ~/.Xresources link is produced.
options.type: null or (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or string)))

options.title: xsession.preferStatusNotifierItems
options.description: Whether tray applets should prefer using the Status Notifier Items (SNI) protocol, commonly called App Indicators. Note, not all tray applets or status bars support SNI.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.awesome.enable

options.title: xsession.windowManager.awesome.noArgb

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.enable
options.description: Whether to enable bspwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.package
options.description: The bspwm package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.alwaysResetDesktops
options.description: If set to true, desktops configured in monitors will be reset every time the config is run.
options.note:
If set to false, desktops will only be configured the first time the config is run.
This is useful if you want to dynamically add desktops and you don’t want them to be destroyed if you
re-run bspwmrc.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfig
options.description: Additional shell commands to be run at the end of the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfigEarly
options.description: Like extraConfig, except commands are run at the start of the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.monitors
options.description: Specifies the names of desktops to create on each monitor.
options.type: attribute set of list of string

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules
options.description: Rule configuration. The keys of the attribute set are the targets of the rules.
options.type: attribute set of (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.border
options.description: Whether the node should have border.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.center
options.description: Whether the node will be put in the center, in floating mode.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.desktop
options.description: The desktop where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.focus
options.description: Whether the node should gain focus on creation.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.follow
options.description: Whether focus should follow the node when it is moved.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.hidden
options.description: Whether the node should occupy any space.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.layer
options.description: The layer where a new window should spawn.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.locked
options.description: Whether the node should ignore node --close messages.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.manage
options.description: Whether the window should be managed by bspwm. If false, the window will be ignored by bspwm entirely. This is useful for overlay apps, e.g. screenshot tools.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.marked
options.description: Whether the node will be marked for deferred actions.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.monitor
options.description: The monitor where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.node
options.description: The node where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.private
options.description: Whether the node should stay in the same tiling position and size.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.rectangle
options.description: The node’s geometry, in the format WxH+X+Y.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.splitDir
options.description: The direction where the container is going to be split.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.splitRatio
options.description: The ratio between the new window and the previous existing window in the desktop.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.state
options.description: The state in which a new window should spawn.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.sticky
options.description: Whether the node should stay on the focused desktop.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.settings
options.description: General settings given to bspc config.

options.description: Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/herbstluftwm/autostart.

options.description: Herbstluftwm keybinds.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.mousebinds
options.description: Herbstluftwm mousebinds.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.rules
options.description: Herbstluftwm rules.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.settings
options.description: Herbstluftwm settings.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.tags
options.description: Tags to create on startup.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.enable
options.description: Whether to enable i3 window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.package
options.description: The i3 package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config
options.description: i3 configuration options.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns
options.description: An attribute set that assigns applications to workspaces based on criteria.
options.type: attribute set of list of attribute set of (string or boolean)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars
options.description: i3 bars settings blocks. Set to empty list to remove bars completely.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors
options.description: Bar color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, fields and RGB color hex-codes as values. See default values for the reference. Note that ‘background’, ‘status’, and ‘separator’ parameters take a single RGB value.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_colors.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.activeWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace is active.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.background
options.description: Background color of the bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.bindingMode
options.description: Border, background and text color for the binding mode indicator

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedBackground
options.description: Background color of the bar on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedSeparator
options.description: Text color to be used for the separator on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedStatusline
options.description: Text color to be used for the statusline on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace has focus.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.inactiveWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace does not have focus and is not active.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.separator
options.description: Text color to be used for the separator.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.statusline
options.description: Text color to be used for the statusline.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.urgentWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace contains a window with the urgency hint set.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.command
options.description: Command that will be used to start a bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines for this bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.fonts
options.description: Font configuration for this bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.hiddenState
options.description: The default bar mode when ‘bar.mode’ == ‘hide’.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.id
options.description: Specifies the bar ID for the configured bar instance. If this option is missing, the ID is set to bar-x, where x corresponds to the position of the embedding bar block in the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.mode
options.description: Bar visibility mode.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.position
options.description: The edge of the screen i3bar should show up.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.statusCommand
options.description: Command that will be used to get status lines.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.trayOutput
options.description: Where to output tray.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.trayPadding
options.description: Sets the pixel padding of the system tray. This padding will surround the tray on all sides and between each item.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.workspaceButtons
options.description: Whether workspace buttons should be shown or not.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.workspaceNumbers
options.description: Whether workspace numbers should be displayed within the workspace buttons.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors
options.description: Color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, ‘indicator’ and ‘childBorder’ fields and RGB color hex-codes as values. See default values for the reference. Note that ‘i3.config.colors.background’ parameter takes a single RGB value.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_changing_colors.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.background
options.description: Background color of the window. Only applications which do not cover the whole area expose the color.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.focused
options.description: A window which currently has the focus.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.focusedInactive
options.description: A window which is the focused one of its container, but it does not have the focus at the moment.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.placeholder
options.description: Background and text color are used to draw placeholder window contents (when restoring layouts). Border and indicator are ignored.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.unfocused
options.description: A window which is not focused.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.urgent
options.description: A window which has its urgency hint activated.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.defaultWorkspace
options.description: The default workspace to show when i3 is launched. This must to correspond to the value of the keybinding of the default workspace.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating
options.description: Floating window settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.border
options.description: Floating windows border width.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.criteria
options.description: List of criteria for windows that should be opened in a floating mode.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.modifier
options.description: Modifier key or keys that can be used to drag floating windows.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.titlebar
options.description: Whether to show floating window titlebars.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus
options.description: Focus related settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.followMouse
options.description: Whether focus should follow the mouse.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.forceWrapping
options.description: Whether to force focus wrapping in tabbed or stacked containers.
options.note: This option is deprecated, use focus.wrapping instead.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.mouseWarping
options.description: Whether mouse cursor should be warped to the center of the window when switching focus to a window on a different output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.newWindow
options.description: This option modifies focus behavior on new window activation.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#focus_on_window_activation

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.wrapping
options.description: Whether the window focus commands automatically wrap around the edge of containers.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_focus_wrapping

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.fonts
options.description: Font configuration for window titles, nagbar…

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps
options.description: Gaps related settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.bottom
options.description: Bottom gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.horizontal
options.description: Horizontal gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.inner
options.description: Inner gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.left
options.description: Left gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.outer
options.description: Outer gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.right
options.description: Right gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.smartBorders
options.description: This option controls whether to disable container borders on workspace with a single container.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.smartGaps
options.description: This option controls whether to disable all gaps (outer and inner) on workspace with a single container.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.top
options.description: Top gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.vertical
options.description: Vertical gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keybindings
options.description: An attribute set that assigns a key press to an action using a key symbol. See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.note:
Consider to use lib.mkOptionDefault function to extend or override
default keybindings instead of specifying all of them from scratch.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keycodebindings
options.description: An attribute set that assigns keypress to an action using key code. See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.menu
options.description: Default launcher to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modes
options.description: An attribute set that defines binding modes and keybindings inside them
options.note:
Only basic keybinding is supported (bindsym keycomb action),
for more advanced setup use ‘i3.extraConfig’.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modifier
options.description: Modifier key that is used for all default keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup
options.description: Commands that should be executed at startup.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_automatically_starting_applications_on_i3_startup.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.always
options.description: Whether to run command on each i3 restart.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.command
options.description: Command that will be executed on startup.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.notification
options.description: Whether to enable startup-notification support for the command. See --no-startup-id option description in the i3 user guide.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.workspace
options.description: Launch application on a particular workspace. DEPRECATED: Use xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns instead. See https://github.com/nix-community/home-manager/issues/265.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.terminal
options.description: Default terminal to run.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window
options.description: Window titlebar and border settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.border
options.description: Window border width.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands
options.description: List of commands that should be executed on specific windows. See for_window i3wm option documentation.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands.*.command
options.description: i3wm command to execute.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands.*.criteria
options.description: Criteria of the windows on which command should be executed.
options.note:
A value of true is equivalent to using an empty
criteria (which is different from an empty string criteria).

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.hideEdgeBorders
options.description: Hide window borders adjacent to the screen edges.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.titlebar
options.description: Whether to show window titlebars.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceAutoBackAndForth
options.description: Assume you are on workspace “1: www” and switch to “2: IM” using mod+2 because somebody sent you a message. You don’t need to remember where you came from now, you can just press $mod+2 again to switch back to “1: www”.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceLayout
options.description: The mode in which new containers on workspace level will start.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign
options.description: Assign workspaces to outputs.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.output
options.description: Name(s) of the output(s) from    i3-msg -t get_outputs .

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.workspace
options.description: Name of the workspace to assign.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/i3/config.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Spectrwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.package
options.description: Package providing the spectrwm command.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.bindings
options.description: Spectrwm keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.programs
options.description: Spectrwm programs variables.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.quirks
options.description: Spectrwm quicks (custom window rules).

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.settings
options.description: Spectrwm settings.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.unbindings
options.description: List of keybindings to disable from default Spectrwm configuration.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enable
options.description: Whether to enable xmonad window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enableContribAndExtras
options.description: Enable xmonad-{contrib,extras} in xmonad.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.config
options.description: The configuration file to be used for xmonad. This must be an absolute path or null in which case ~/.xmonad/xmonad.hs will not be managed by Home Manager.
options.note:
If this option is set to a non-null value,
recompilation of xmonad outside of Home Manager (e.g. via
xmonad --recompile) will fail.
options.example:
pkgs.writeText "xmonad.hs" ''
  import XMonad
  main = xmonad defaultConfig
      { terminal    = "urxvt"
      , modMask     = mod4Mask
      , borderWidth = 3
      }
''

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.extraPackages
options.description: Extra packages available to GHC when rebuilding xmonad. The value must be a function which receives the attribute set defined in haskellPackages as the sole argument.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.haskellPackages
options.description: The haskellPackages used to build xmonad and other packages. This can be used to change the GHC version used to build xmonad and the packages listed in extraPackages.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.libFiles
options.description: Additional files that will be saved in ~/.xmonad/lib/ and included in the configuration build. The keys are the file names while the values are paths to the contents of the files.
